data.title: Not as good as it use to be!
data.text: This place has turned into a run down restaurant.  The place was not very clean and the interior has not changed in thirty years.  Don' t go there if you have a choice.

data.title: Great Diner with Great name
data.text: was in Joliet and needed a place to eat so I parked the car and walke down the quaint downtown. I came accross this diner.  The name hooked me.  It is a classic diner, like in the 1950's .  Diner bar with bar stools, and tables.  I sat at a table. Staff was nice, and service was quick. Food was very good. would recommend.   And if you have kids should take them there to show them what an old diner was in their grandpas day.

data.title: A friendly place for a meal or a snack
data.text: We only had sandwiches and tea one lunchtime when we'd really only stopped here to see the Rialto Theatre (as we did Route 66). Staff very friendly; food was good & not expensive. Quite a lot of Route 66 memorabilia, posters, articles, photos, etc, so worth popping in to check it out.

data.title: It's okay...
data.text:
Jury duty brought me here today.  Décor is simple.  They attempted to create a diner feel, but it falls short.
The cream of broccoli soup was pretty good, but the burgers were pre-pressed frozen burgers you can buy at a warehouse grocery store.  Not all that great...

data.title: Excellent breakfast close to the casino. Highly Recommend.
data.text: We were staying at Harrahs casino and were looking for other options for breakfast since the buffet doesn't serve breakfast. This little diner is just a couple of blocks away and was recommended to us. We were the only patrons when we arrived, which was a little worrisome. We were greeted as we came in the door. Immediately offered coffee and our drink orders taken. A large variety of food available on the menu. We ordered and our food arrived shortly thereafter hot, fresh, and good. Restaurant is vintage style, but is very clean and very well kept. Staff were attentive and glasses stayed full. Food great and there was a lot of it. I would highly recommend this place!!

data.title: Nice breakfast and lunch spot
data.text: A nice cute locals kind of place.  It's clean with friendly service, and right downtown.  A short walk from Harrah's.  Good breakfast, and the prices were reasonable.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: This little diner was amazing! The service was excellent and the coffee never empty and delicious. Our food was plentiful and inexpensive as well as being very tasty. I would highly recommend this place!

data.title: Great Breakfast
data.text: We read about Joliet 66 Diner and had two breakfasts there that we throughly enjoyed.  The waitress was very friendly and visited with us.  The whole place offered an environment of relaxation and friendship.

data.title: Sunday breakfast with my Wife
data.text: Had read about this location and decided to stop in for Sunday Breakfast. Plenty of parking in downtown Joliet. The place was clean and very retro. Wall signs from the 50's and 60's everywhere but not over done. We sat at the counter which was a long counter with old school top. They have a wide menu but as usual, I had the biscuits and gravy with a couple of eggs over medium. The biscuits and gravy were excellent. Very flavorful and plenty on the plate for any toast or pancakes you might want to top. The service was top notch and the coffee was hot and plentiful. Became my new favorite place to go to when we are in Joliet.

data.title: Nice lunch
data.text: I just started working in downtown Joliet. I have had lunch here a couple of times. The food is good and it has a nice menu.

data.title: Such a quaint place!
data.text: We ate here three days in a row! Your coffee cup never goes empty. Great food, great service! Decorations were so adorable. Nice, clean restrooms.  Also, it's walking distance to Harrah's Casino and Silver Cross Field. Try the corned beef hash!

data.title: Breakfast on Route 66
data.text:
We left our hotel to get through Chicago before the traffic got to busy, so we didn't have time for breakfast. So when we got to Joliet we had breakfast at the Route 66 Diner. I had scrambled egg with hash brown,off the special menu, the scrambled egg was the best I have ever had in my life, and the hash browns were real potato.
My wife had the strawberry pancakes and didn't leave a crumb, which is a pretty good sign that she enjoyed them.
Coffee was great and true bottomless cup.
Staff so friendly and help full.
If you are doing the Route 66 or just in the area you should call in the food will not disappoint.

data.title: Best place to eat in joliet
data.text: I have eaten here for breakfast and lunch and I can't say enough about this restaurant. The service is great,  the food is very fresh and plentiful, and the price is cheap for all the food you get. Everything here is perfect except that they are only open until 3pm. If you are in downtown joliet,  you have to eat here. I stayed at harrahs hotel and Casino,  but walked up the street to eat my meals here. I wish this place was in my town.

data.title: Mother's Day Treat!
data.text: Staying at Harrah's Casino and since there isn't much in the way of dining, we took a 2 minute walk directly across from the hotel and stumbled upon this gem! A breakfast treat for Mother's Day followed by a long stemmed rose was indeed the icing on the cake! Our breakfast of the most delicious, golden hash browns and a fluffy, veggie omelet with feta cheese made with real eggs versus artificial carton and decent coffee was a great start to our day. This little gem has a nice and clean feel and their employees are obviously conscious of doing a great job! Our young server, Claudia, answered every question without hesitation and knew her menu. Service was impeccable and very impressive, being as young as she was. She could easily serve in the finer restaurants with higher levels of expectation without any problem. Should you be in the Joliet area and want a quick bite of delicious food....this place will not disappoint in any aspect! Great job to their staff and kudos to Claudia for an awesome experience! We will be back!

data.title: A must do for breakfast
data.text:
We were introduced to here by a friend on our first morning and we ate there every other morning before starting our day of touring. Service and quality of food is great and the staff are so warm and welcoming.

Well worth popping in.

data.title: Cute Retro Diner
data.text:
The atmosphere of this place is very fun, and the service is friendly and attentive.  They have a pretty big menu selection, but the food is nothing special.

Still glad we came, though.

data.title: After Tourney Luch
data.text: I have wanted to try this place for yesrs.  It finally worked out today. I'm glad it did.  My husband and I had lunch and our sons had breakfast.  We all enjoyed our meals.  The biggest hits: Pancakes, onion rings, and cream of chicken soup--all had rave reviews from whoever ate them! The service was good and the decor took me back to the way restaurants used to look.

data.title: Breakfast!
data.text: Sat at bar area for breakfast, busy but great service and food was delicious, friendly staff. Only wish they would open for dinner.

data.title: Great Breakfasts
data.text: This is one of my go to's.  They make the best breakfast in town, bar none.  Try those biscuits & gravy

data.title: Home Cooked Greatness
data.text: Great Place! Home cooked food! My bands love that they have grits too! Staff is nice and friendly . . .
